subject: Quneitra offensive
object: Quneitra Governorate and Daraa Governorate, Syria

subject: Quneitra offensive
object: Rebel victory | Rebels take control of about 80 percent of towns and villages in Quneitra province and seize the Syrian-controlled side of the Golan. | Rebels capture the Quneitra Crossing, ten villages/towns, one base and two strategic hills | Rebels pull back from western Damascus countryside into northern Daraa countryside | Al-Nusra Front takes 45 U.N. peacekeepers hostage on 28 August | (released on 12 September) | Army counter-attack on Mashara repelled.

subject: Quneitra offensive
object: Road from Quneitra to Damascus in the offensive zone (photo taken in 2005)

subject: Belligerents
object: SRCC | Free Syrian Army | Islamic Front | Al-Nusra Front | Syria | Syrian Arab Republic | Syrian Armed Forces | National Defense Force | United Nations | UNDOF

subject: Commanders and leaders
object: Muhammad Majid al-Khatib | (Alwiya al-Furqan leader) | Abu Uthman | (Ansar al-Huda commander) | Brigadier-general Nazir Fuddah | [ | citation needed | ] | Lt. Gen. Iqbal Singh Singha

subject: Units involved
object: Alwiya al-Furqan | Ahrar ash-Sham | Ansar al-Huda | Ababil Houran Brigade | Fursan al-Ababil brigade | Jabhat Ansar al-Islam | Youth of Sunnah Brigade | Quneitra Military Council | 7th Division | 90th Brigade | Unknown

subject: Strength
object: Unknown | Unknown | UNDOF: Hundreds | 119-120 | (Quneitra border crossing area)

subject: Casualties and losses
object: 76+ rebels killed | 71+ Syrian soldiers killed | 11+ captured | 1 Sukhoi Su-24 fighter jet downed by Israel | 44-45 U.N. peacekeepers captured
